ca.keefer.sanemethod.Entity
Class Platformer

java.lang.Object
  ca.keefer.sanemethod.Entity.AbstractEntity
      ca.keefer.sanemethod.Entity.Platformer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Player
public class Platformer
extends AbstractEntity

A special type of entity that implements platformer-style physical dynamics

Version:
1.4
Author:
Christopher Keefer

Constructor Summary
Platformer(float x, float y, int shapeType, net.phys2d.math.Vector2f dimensions, float mass, float restitution, float friction, net.phys2d.math.Vector2f maxVelocity, boolean rotatable, int zOrder)
          Create a platformer with no graphical representation - this is so a further class can extend the platformer class and replace the image with a series of animations Note that the dimensions must be provided as an array of Vector2f - this is to allow for the creation of complex polygons for the body's shape representation in the physical world; for a simple box or circle type, just the first element of the array shall be used.

Constructor Detail

Platformer

public Platformer(float x,
                  float y,
                  int shapeType,
                  net.phys2d.math.Vector2f dimensions,
                  float mass,
                  float restitution,
                  float friction,
                  net.phys2d.math.Vector2f maxVelocity,
                  boolean rotatable,
                  int zOrder,
                  org.newdawn.slick.Image image)
Create a platformer with a single static image representation Note that the dimensions must be provided as an array of Vector2f - this is to allow for the creation of complex polygons for the body's shape representation in the physical world; for a simple box or circle type, just the first element of the array shall be used.

Parameters:
x - Position on the horiztonal plane
y - Position on the vertical plane
shapeType - One of either SHAPE_TYPE_CIRCLE, SHAPE_TYPE_BOX or SHAPE_TYPE_POLYGON
dimensions - Vector2f array, containing the points of a complex shape
mass - Mass of the object - default is 1.0
restitution - The degree to which this body transfers momentum - default is 1.0f
friction - The friction on the surface of this body
MaxVelocity - Vector2f the maximum velocities this body can reach in the x and y ranges
rotatable - Whether this body is rotatable - default false
zOrder - Controls the sorting of entities - not necessary if each entity is added to a seperate layer
image - Static image for this Platformer

Platformer

public Platformer(float x,
                  float y,
                  int shapeType,
                  net.phys2d.math.Vector2f dimensions,
                  float mass,
                  float restitution,
                  float friction,
                  net.phys2d.math.Vector2f maxVelocity,
                  boolean rotatable,
                  int zOrder)
Create a platformer with no graphical representation - this is so a further class can extend the platformer class and replace the image with a series of animations Note that the dimensions must be provided as an array of Vector2f - this is to allow for the creation of complex polygons for the body's shape representation in the physical world; for a simple box or circle type, just the first element of the array shall be used.

Parameters:
x - Position on the horiztonal plane
y - Position on the vertical plane
shapeType - One of either SHAPE_TYPE_CIRCLE, SHAPE_TYPE_BOX or SHAPE_TYPE_POLYGON
dimensions - Vector2f array, containing the points of a complex shape
mass - Mass of the object - default is 1.0
restitution - The degree to which this body transfers momentum - default is 1.0f
friction - The friction on the surface of this body
MaxVelocity - Vector2f the maximum velocities this body can reach in the x and y ranges
rotatable - Whether this body is rotatable - default false
zOrder - Controls the sorting of entities - not necessary if each entity is added to a seperate layer

preUpdate

public void preUpdate(int delta)
Description copied from interface: Entity
Update this entity. This method is called once before physical world is updated each cycle. It is only ever called once per update.

Parameters:
delta - The amount of time passed since last update

Parameters:

onGroundImpl

protected boolean onGroundImpl(net.phys2d.raw.Body body)
Implementation on ground check. This can be expensive so best to try and limit its use by caching FIXED[more or less]: We check this only when we might suspect the body is not on the ground (ie. when falling) - this helps make the expense of this function less onerous

Returns:
True if the body is resting on the ground

public int getZOrder()
Description copied from interface: Entity
Get the zOrder (depth) of an Entity - an Entity with a higher zOrder will be drawn after/over an Entity with a lower zOrder.

Returns:
zOrder/depth of this enttiy
